author: EXM7777
text:
if you've got a spare weekend and actually want to get better with LLMs...

build these three projects:

1. your own "benchmarking" toolkit
- not those fancy dev tools, just prompts + systems + messy projects with tons of files
- run each new model through YOUR actual work
- you'll know within 15 minutes if it's worth switching
- saves 3 hours of reading other people's reviews that don't match your use case

2. a mini-saas for each repetitive task
- go into cursor/lovable, build something embarrassingly simple
- host it for $2/month, just for you, who cares about "security"
- the goal is just to stop doing the same boring task manually

3. an AI assets library in notion
- prompts, context files, MCPs, random github repos you might need
- sort them, make it easy to find
- when you need that one weird prompt at 3am, you'll find it in 30 seconds

these feel like side projects but it's actually the start of a decent infrastructure
